[line]

[*]Falmer Crossbow
[*]Actualize Apparel
[*]Tribunal Robes and Tribunal Masks
[*]DFB Crossbow Expansion
[*]Aetherium Swords and Armor
[*]Heisenberg's Equipment
[*]Ragna-Rok's Mudcrab Armor
[*]Bandoliers
[*]The Witcher 2 Models
[*]Isil Narsil's LotR Weapons
[*]Deadly Dragons Armory
[*]Falskaar
[*]Katana Crafting
[*]Warmonger Armory
[*]Complete Crafting Overhaul Remade[size=4] [color=red]My CCOR settings assume you have [i]all[/i] the files for the mods listed under "Incorporated Mods" on the CCOR page. If you don't and you use these CCOR settings without editing them, you'll have a lot of missing meshes and textures.[/color][/size]
[*]Netch Leather Armor
[*]Velvet Robes and Cloaks
[*]Ket WEAPONIZER
[*]Dwemerverse
[/list]

[size=4]Installation: [/size]Other than the Immersive Armors 7(.1) settings, detailed below, there are two ways to use these:
[list=1]
[*]Open my Custom.xml and cut and paste the entries you want into your Custom.xml
[*]Overwrite your Custom.xml with my Custom.xml
[/list]

The first is better if you've already lootified some stuff and don't want to lose your work, but it's up to you.

[size=5]Immersive Armors 7(.1!):[/size] I also have settings for Immersive Armors 7 which are included (7.1 is a seperate download, but do it the same way), but those have to be handled slightly differently:To use them, unlike the other settings, you must:
[list=1]
[*]Open your Lootification.xml (Not Custom.xml)
[*]CTRL-F and find "Hothtrooper44_ArmorCompilation.esp"
[*][i]Completely[/i] remove the old Hothtrooper44_ArmorCompilation.esp section from [font=Courier New][color=#00ff00][size=3]<mod modName="Hothtrooper44_ArmorCompilation.esp"> [/size][/color][/font]to [font=Courier New][color=#00ff00][size=3]</mod>[/size][/color][/font]
[*]Replace it with my settings.
[/list]
The reason for this is that Lootification doesn't like having settings for the same file in both Lootification.xml and Custom.xml, and will crash with a cryptic error message. The reason you need all new settings is because Immersive Armors 7 changes a lot of things under the hood, like, for instance: [color=red][b]EVERY SINGLE EDID[/b][/color]. Anyhow, enjoy!
